meanings.definition: Relating to the sense of hearing.
meanings.sent1: The aurally impaired student preferred visual learning.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the aurally pleasing sound of birds chirping.
meanings.sent3: The aurally talented musician could play any tune by ear.
meanings.sent4: His aurally sharp ears could detect even the faintest of sounds.
meanings.sent5: The aurally rich symphony filled the concert hall with beautiful music.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is perceived through the ears.
meanings.sent1: She listened aurally to the music playing softly in the background.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were given aurally rather than in writing.
meanings.sent3: The comedian aurally mimicked different accents to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent4: The news was delivered aurally through the radio broadcast.
meanings.sent5: The story was told aurally by the storyteller, captivating the listeners.
